article.description: S. Carolina St. 69, Carver Bible College 67
article.headline: S. Carolina St. 69, Carver Bible College 67
article.linkText: S. Carolina St. 69, Carver Bible College 67
article.story: ORANGEBURG, S.C. -- Darnell Porter scored 24 points and South Carolina State held off Carver Bible 69-67 on Friday night. The Bulldogs (2-1) overcame a nine-point deficit in the first half but could not put away Carver until the final seconds. Neither team led by more than four points in the second half. With the score tied 64-64 with 41 seconds remaining, the Bulldogs made 5 of 6 free throw attempts the rest of the way to seal the win. Carver led 66-65 with 11 seconds remaining, then Rio Pitt made two free throws to put the Bulldogs ahead for good at 67-66. Tyvon Williams added two foul shots with 2 seconds to play for the Bulldogs. South Carolina State won despite shooting 37.5 percent (21 of 56) from the field and committing 24 turnovers. James Barber led Carver Bible (0-7) with 24 points. James Corner added 11 points and Nicholas Hood added 10 for Carver.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
